title: Matt Koalska
text:
Matthew James Koalska (born May 16, 1980 in <a href="Saint%20Paul%2C%20Minnesota">Saint Paul, Minnesota</a>) is an American retired <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> <a href="Centre%20%28ice%20hockey%29">center</a>. He was drafted in the fifth round, 154th overall, by the <a href="Nashville%20Predators">Nashville Predators</a> in the <a href="2000%20NHL%20Entry%20Draft">2000 NHL Entry Draft</a>. He played 3 games in the <a href="National%20Hockey%20League">National Hockey League</a> with the <a href="New%20York%20Islanders">New York Islanders</a> during the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20NHL%20season">2005–06 season</a>. He retired in 2007 due to heart issues.
Playing career.
Koalska played his college hockey at the University of Minnesota from 2000–2004 winning two National Championships.
Koalska made his professional debut with the <a href="Bridgeport%20Sound%20Tigers">Bridgeport Sound Tigers</a> of the <a href="American%20Hockey%20League">American Hockey League</a> in the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20AHL%20season">2004–05 season</a>. He appeared in three <a href="NHL">NHL</a> games with the <a href="New%20York%20Islanders">New York Islanders</a> in the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20NHL%20season">2005–06 season</a>, going scoreless. On January 5, 2007, the Islanders traded Koalska to the <a href="Ottawa%20Senators">Ottawa Senators</a> in exchange for <a href="defenceman%20%28ice%20hockey%29">defenceman</a> <a href="Tom%C3%A1%C5%A1%20Malec">Tomas Malec</a>. Koalska finished the season with the Senators' AHL affiliate, the <a href="Binghamton%20Senators">Binghamton Senators</a> before signing in the off-season with HC Bolazno in the <a href="Serie%20A%20%28hockey%29">Italian Elite League</a>. However, Koalska did not play with Bolazno, having to retire due to a heart condition. He returned to University of Minnesota to complete his degree.
